p: Results were expressed as mean ± standard error of the mean (SEM). One-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) was used for data with normal distribution (body weight, ALP, ALT, AST, TP, Cr, urea, uric acid, HGB, RBC, MCH, RDW, WBC and platelets), while Kruskal-Wallis was used for data with non-normal distribution (HCT, MCHC and MCV). IBM SPSS software version 22 (Chicago, USA) was used to analyse all data. Statistical significant was considered at ( p < 0.05).
